remarks: Change the index set to a subset in an upper integer product. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Dec-2017.)
statement:
prodss.1 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ B ) $.
prodss.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> C e. CC ) $.
prodss.3 $e |- ( ph -> E. n e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) E. y ( y =/= 0 /\ seq n ( x. , ( k e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) |-> if ( k e. B , C , 1 ) ) ) ~~> y ) ) $.
prodss.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( B \ A ) ) -> C = 1 ) $.
prodss.5 $e |- ( ph -> B C_ ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
prodss $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. A C = prod_ k e. B C ) $.
$d A k n y $.
$d B k n y $.
$d C n y $.
$d M k n y $.
$d k n ph y $.
